results.name: a(n) is the smallest number k such that the LCM of the terms of the Collatz trajectory of k has n distinct prime factors.
formula: a(n) = Min{k; A087227(k)=n}, where A087227(k) = A001221(A087226(k)); A087226(k) = lcm(terms in Collatz trajectory of k).
example: a(10)=57 because 57 is the smallest number such that the LCM of the terms in its Collatz trajectory has 10 different prime factors: A082226(57) = 864203580240 = 2^4*3*5*7*11*13*17*19*37*43.
mathematica: c[x_] := (1-Mod[x, 2])*(x/2)+Mod[x, 2]*(3*x+1)c[1]=1; fpl[x_] := Delete[FixedPointList[c, x], -1] ef[x_] := Length[FactorInteger[Apply[LCM, fpl[x]]]] t=Table[0, {256}]; Do[s=ef[n]; If[s<257&&t[[s]]==0, t[[s]]=n], {n, 1, 1000}]; t
